utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Boy, seems like forever since the four of us have been out to eat, you know? Just the guys.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, God! Yes, we get it. You have a girlfriend now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A little jealous, are we?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, I’m not jealous. All right, I’d kill a hobo if it’ll get me laid. Now, can we order?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear Lord, they re-did the menu.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So what? It’s the same food.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, is it? Look at this. General Tso’s Chicken is no longer listed under specialties. It’s now under chicken.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, General Tso.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not Tso the chicken, so the question. So?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, why is it no longer a specialty? Did the chef lose confidence in the dish or himself? And look over here, shrimp in mobster sauce. What is mobster sauce?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s obviously a typo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perhaps. Perhaps this restaurant’s now a front for organized crime. For all we know, the mobster sauce contains actual chunks of deceased mobsters.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, I think it just means it’s the kind of sauce that mobsters like.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It doesn’t mean any of that! It’s a typo.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what? Let’s just get a pizza.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good idea. We’ll go to Corleone’s.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sure, no mobsters there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, the more I think about it, the mobster sauce couldn’t possibly contain chunks of mobster.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And why is that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was listed under seafood.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What if they were mobsters who slept with the fishes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, are we having a serious conversation or not?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (noticing their door has been broken open)
utterance.content: What the…?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The TV is gone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So are our laptops.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh God, oh God, oh, God! It’s all right. They didn’t take my comic books.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They took our TV, two laptops, four external hard-drives, our PS2, our PS3, our X-Box, our X-Box 360, our classic Nintendo, our Super Nintendo, our Nintendo 64 and our Wii.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We like games.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Right, games. They took Halo 1, Halo 2, Halo 3, Call of Duty 1, Call of Duty 2, Call of Duty 3, Rock Band, Rock Band 2, Final Fantasy 1 thru 9, The Legend of Zelda, The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time, The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess, Super Mario Brothers, Super Mario Galaxy, Mario and Sonic at the Winter Olympics and Ms. Pacman.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Assorted video games.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When does the CSI team get here?

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In anticipation of their arrival, I’ve bagged some evidence. One of the thieves had the audacity to quench his thirst while ransacking our home. You should be able to pull some good prints off this. And now, here are my prints so you can rule me out as a suspect.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Leonard. It’s too early to discount the possibility of this being an inside job.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Would I be completely out of line to ask you to shoot him?

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: I’d be happy to put him under a 72-hour psychiatric hold.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not crazy. My mother had me tested.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: We’re done here. Call this number, and we’ll fax you a copy of the report so you can submit it to your insurance company.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that’s the end of your inquiry?

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Do you have any more information that might be relevant?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, my goodness. Where do I begin? For instance, my laptop contained four out of the five gedanken experiments necessary for a cogent restatement of the quantum measurement problem.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How is that going to help them?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, they could monitor scientific publications and see if anyone posts such a cogent restatement in the next couple of months. If so, the authors are most likely in possession of my stolen laptop.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Good night, fellas. Come on, Bochco.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are we supposed to do now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The only thing we can do. Watch TV on our phones until the criminals return and bludgeon us to death in our sleep.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Does that mean you’ve ruled me out as a suspect?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, how I wish I could.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I do not have to urinate. I am the master of my own bladder. Drat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t believe it. If I hadn’t been working the dinner shift, I would’ve run

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, there’s no reason for you to be scared.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m not scared. I would’ve gone all Nebraska on their asses.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard and Penny. Leonard and Penny. Leonard and Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hand me the bat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We just had a major crime in the building, and you open the door without asking who it is?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It won’t happen again, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nothing. Just wanted to see if you were both okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re fine, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, then. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good night. That was weird, even for him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard and Penny. Leonard and Penny. Leonard and Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sheldon. Sheldon Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: May I come in?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I see you’re drinking wine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, we are. And we’re about to go to bed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, do you want to sleep here tonight?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, as small as Leonard is, I don’t think the two of you’d be comfortable on the couch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not what I want, it’s what evolution wants. Human beings are primates. Primates have evolved to live in groups, both for protection and support.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: But you don’t like other people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I do tonight. It’s scary over there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s getting scary here, too.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um… three little kittens? Three little pigs? God, I don’t know. Star Wars?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did we win? Can we go to bed?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good Lord, I could not have made this easier. Hydrogen atom, H, plus pigs minus pea, Higgs. Bow, General Zod trapped in the Phantom Zone. Bow-zone. Pear. Tickle. Pear-tickle. Higgs Boson Particle. How could you not get that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s right, Penny. It’s all there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, Sheldon, sweetie, I know you’re feeling insecure, but we’ve really got to go to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. I’ll take the first watch and wake you at 0400.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, wait, what’s 0400?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: 4am.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s, like, in 45 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just keep walking.

utterance.speaker: Woman on TV
utterance.content: It’s quiet out there.

utterance.speaker: Man on TV
utterance.content: Maybe a little too quiet.

utterance.speaker: Woman on TV
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Man on TV
utterance.content: Just gonna take a look around outside.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bad idea.

utterance.speaker: Woman on TV
utterance.content: No, Jim, don’t open the door!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Listen to her, Jim.

utterance.speaker: Man on TV
utterance.content: Don’t worry, there’s no one out here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard and Penny! Leonard and Penny! Leonard and Penny!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, we’ve got a titanium dead bolt and a reinforced jamb controlled by a state-of-the-art electronic access system.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What if they cut the power?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: There’s a 200-watt uninterruptible backup power supply.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What if someone steals my keys?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: There are independent voice and fingerprint scanners.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What if someone kidnaps me, forces me to record my voice, and then cuts off my thumb?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll send them a basket of muffins.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Now, inside, we’ve got motion detectors, infrared sensors, and cameras connected to a server running state-of-the-art facial recognition software.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where did you get all this stuff?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I got a buddy over at the Department of Defence.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He just gave it to you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sure he would have if I had asked. Ironically, their security isn’t all that good.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Raj, your car is blocking me… What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry, let me help you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wonderful security system if we’re attacked by a school of tuna.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t worry, the net’s going to be electrified. Picture her on the floor, spasming uncontrollably.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Better.

utterance.content: Sheldon’s journal. Security system in place. However, sleep continues to elude me. I’ve seen the underbelly of Pasadena, this so-called City of Roses, and it haunts me. Ah, the injustice, I lie here awake, tormented, while out there evil lurks, probably playing Donkey Kong on my classic Nintendo. Oh, dear. I am the master of my own bladder. Leonard and Penny. Leonard and Penny. Leonard and Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: God, Sheldon. What the hell are you doing out there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I heard a noise.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It was us. We knocked over a lamp.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would you knock over a lamp?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We were going to have…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He doesn’t need to know what we were doing, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh! No, she’s right, I don’t need to know what you were doing. Carry on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing? Use the door.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good thinking. Perhaps I’ll check the perimeter and make some warm milk.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great, you do that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would you like me to bring you some warm milk?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m lactose intolerant.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And you don’t wish to alarm me with any more loud noises, very thoughtful. Warm milk, Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. Good night to you, sir. Miss.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh, what can you do? Here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Looks like Wolowitz got the net electrified.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m fine. Although I’m no longer the master of my own bladder.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My new computer came with Windows 7. Windows 7 is much more user-friendly than Windows Vista. I don’t like that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t you think looking for a new city to live in is a bit of an overreaction?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Our apartment was broken into, our security system tried to kill me, and as a result, I’m leaving Pasadena forever. Tell me how that’s overreacting.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon, you can’t move. Don’t you need to stay in one place so the mother ship can find you when it returns?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, if that were only true. Unfortunately, as I’m earthbound for the foreseeable future, I need to find a location that’s more hospitable than the mean streets of Pasadena. Like Enid, Oklahoma. Low crime rate and high-speed Internet connectivity, but no model train shops. Sorry, Enid.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is he quitting his job at the university?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, no, he’s going to telecommute. Everybody’s really excited about it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Boone, North Carolina. Every summer since 1952, Boone has hosted an outdoor amphitheater portrayal of the life and times of its namesake, Dan’l Boone. Sounds like something that would attract the wrong crowd. Penny, you’re from Nebraska, correct?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Born and raised.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It will take me a few days to get settled. After I do, I will e-mail you detailed PDFs containing diagrams and instructions that will guide you through packing and shipping the rest of my possessions to Bozeman, Montana. In the meantime, please forward my mail.

When my great-grandfather first came to this country, he put all his hopes and dreams into this little butcher shop he ran on the Lower East Side of New York. You know what happened? Every customer who walked into that butcher shop and asked for a pound of liver, got ripped off. But, those people moved on, and so should you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am moving on. I’m going to be a Bozite.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, I can’t believe I’m saying this, but I’m going to miss you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please, Penny, as you know, I’m not comfortable with prolonged good-byes and maudlin displays of emotion, so I prepared a short video.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon on laptop screen
utterance.content: Greetings. As you know, I’m not comfortable with prolonged good-byes and maudlin displays of emotion, so I prepared this short video. The four of you are three of my closest friends and one treasured acquaintance. Though I cannot state categorically that my life will be diminished by not having you in it, I am comfortable if you choose to believe that. Since you intend to remain in this lawless metropolitan area, statistics suggest that you will succumb to tragic and gruesome ends before we meet again. Live long and prosper.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, that’s so…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (entering again)
utterance.content: You might want to lock the door behind me. This isn’t Bozeman.

utterance.speaker: Howard (after Raj whispers to him)
utterance.content: How the hell do I know who’s the friend and who’s the acquaintance?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is a bracing cold, an invigorating cold. Lord, is it cold!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Help you with your bags, sir?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you, fellow Bozite. And may I say, you are the living embodiment of all the promises made by our lovely town’s Chamber of Commerce. Wait! Wait! Excuse me! One ticket to Pasadena, California, please.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, look who’s back!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. The acquaintance is the first to greet me.
